newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Euroyen firm in late trade on revised data.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Euroyen firm in late trade on revised data.

text.p: SIMEX Euroyen futures were firmer in late trade on Thursday on the back of the stronger yen and revised industrial production data, dealers said.
They said trading was light with market participants reluctant to take fresh positions ahead of the Japanese elections next week.
"The Euroyen was supported by the strong yen in the afternoon and also the revised industrial production data for August which showed more weakness," said a dealer with an Asian futures firm.
August industrial production was revised down to -2.3 percent from the preliminary release of -1.9 percent.
The dealer said there was no clear direction for Euroyen, which seems to be consolidating around current levels.

The new lead Euroyen futures contract, June 1997, settled at 99.13 against a CME close at 99.09 while March was at 99.30 against 99.27. Turnover for both months combined was more than 9,000 contracts.
Japanese goverment bond futures were also firmer with December contracts at 122.81 in late trade against an open at 122.45.
Eurodollar futures were little changed in late trade. Activity was light and trading was confined to within a two-tick range.
Dealers said the market needed fresh leads after the September consumer price data overnight came in within market expections.
A dealer said the lead March contract would see support at 94.25 on the downside.
March Eurodollars settled at 94.27 unchanged from their IMM close of 94.27 while December was 94.35, against a 94.36 previous close.
